title: How to Add Music to a CapCut Video on a Phone, Tablet, or Computer

steps.title: Open a project in CapCut.
steps.content: Open a project in CapCut. Open the CapCut app on your phone or tablet, then create a new project or open an existing draft. To create a new project, tap the New project button, then select a video to add. To open an existing draft, tap Edit in the lower-left corner, then select a project to edit. [1] X Research source CapCut is available for iPhone and iPad in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Place the cursor where you want the music to start.
steps.content: Place the cursor where you want the music to start. This is the vertical white line in the timeline at the bottom of the screen. If you want music to start at the beginning of your video, make sure the line is also at the beginning.

steps.title: Tap Audio.
steps.content: Tap Audio . You can find this at the bottom of the screen. This is the music note icon at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Sounds.
steps.content: Tap Sounds . A new menu will open that allows you to select audio that will be added to your video.

steps.title: Select a sound or audio.
steps.content: Select a sound or audio. You can choose from CapCut's digital library, TikTok original sounds, and your own audio. When you find the audio you want to add, tap the blue plus ( + ) icon next to the sound. To select a TikTok sound , tap the TikTok logo. If you aren't already logged into your TikTok account , do so now. Search or browse for a sound. To select your own music, tap the folder icon. Tap Device on the right, and select the music or audio file you want to use. You may need to allow permission to your library first. Alternatively, you can tap Extract from Video and select a video to extract sound from.

steps.title: Edit the audio (optional).
steps.content: Edit the audio (optional). If it isn't already selected, tap the audio on the timeline. You can edit the audio similar to video clips using the tools at the bottom of the screen. These tools allow you to cut the audio clip, change the volume, change the speed, add a fade-in or fade-out, reduce noise, and more.

steps.title: Tap Export to export the video.
steps.content: Tap Export to export the video. When you're finished, you can save the video by exporting it to your device. Tap the download icon at the top of the screen. You can also tap Share to TikTok to upload it directly to the TikTok app or tap one of the other options to share it with other apps.

steps.title: Start a new project or open an existing draft.
steps.content: Start a new project or open an existing draft. Open the CapCut application on your Windows PC or Mac, then click Create project at the top. Alternatively, you can add music to an existing draft by clicking the draft you want to edit below "Projects." If you haven't installed CapCut on your Windows PC or Mac, download it from https://www.capcut.com/tools/desktop-video-editor .

steps.title: Import a video or audio clip to your project.
steps.content: Import a video or audio clip to your project. To do so, click Import in the upper-left corner, then select a video or audio clip you want to add.

steps.title: Drag a video or audio clip into your timeline.
steps.content: Drag a video or audio clip into your timeline. You'll see all your imported videos and audio clips in the upper-left corner of the window. Click and drag a video or audio clip you want to add to the timeline at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Click Audio.
steps.content: Click Audio . It's the music note icon in the menu bar at the top.

steps.title: Click a song to preview it.
steps.content: Click a song to preview it. You can choose from CapCut's digital music library, sound effects, brand music, and your own audio. Click one of the categories in the menu to the left to browse music and sounds by category, or use the search bar at the top to search. When you find a music clip you want to add, click it to preview it.

steps.title: Select the music you want to add.
steps.content: Select the music you want to add. Click the blue + icon or Add to timeline . This will place the audio clip into your project at the cursor. You can click and drag the audio clip to reposition it in the timeline.

steps.title: Edit the audio (optional).
steps.content: Edit the audio (optional). If it isn't already selected, click the audio on the timeline. Use the options in the upper-right corner of the window to edit the audio. The options under the Basic tab to adjust the volume, add a fade-in or fade-out, add noise reduction, normalize loudness, and more. The Voice Changer tab has options to change the voice. The Speed tab has options to change the music speed.

steps.title: Click Export to save your video.
steps.content: Click Export to save your video. This is at the top of the screen. Use the menu to select the video format, codec, and resolution formats. Then click Export at the bottom of the screen. It may take a few minutes to render the video. While the video is rendering, you can tap one of the options to share your video to TikTok or YouTube at the top.

steps.title: Go to https://www.capcut.com and click Try CapCut Online.
steps.content: Go to https://www.capcut.com and click Try CapCut Online . You will see this option at the top-right corner of the page. The CapCut online video editor is a great option if you can't (or don't want to) install the desktop or mobile CapCut app. You'll need to log into CapCut, which you can do using your TikTok account, Google, Facebook, or by scanning a QR code using the CapCut mobile app. If you don't have an account, select a sign-in option to create one.

steps.title: Create a new project or open a draft.
steps.content: Create a new project or open a draft. Use one of the following steps to do so: To create a new project, click the blue Create new button in the upper-left corner. Then select the aspect ratio you want to use below "Video." To open a draft, click Recent drafts , then click the drafts you want to open.

steps.title: Add a video to your timeline.
steps.content: Add a video to your timeline. You can click Click to upload in the center of the page to open the browsing window, or you can drag and drop a video onto the timeline.

steps.title: Click Audio.
steps.content: Click Audio . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Select a sound or audio.
steps.content: Select a sound or audio. You can choose from CapCut's digital music library, sound effects, brand music, and your own audio. Click the blue + icon or Add to timeline . To select your own music, you must first import it into your library. Click the Media tab > Upload > From computer . Select the audio file. The audio will be added to the timeline.

steps.title: Edit the audio (optional).
steps.content: Edit the audio (optional). If it isn't already selected, click the audio on the timeline. Use the menu on the right to edit the audio. Click Basic to display a menu with basic options, such as adjusting the volume, adding a fade-in or fade-out, noise reduction, or beat detection. You can also use the menu to change voices or change the speed of the audio.

steps.title: Click Export to save your video.
steps.content: Click Export to save your video. This is at the top of the screen. Then tap Download to download the video. Alternatively, you can tap one of the options to share the video to TikTok, YouTube, Facebook, or Instagram Reels.
